bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of dry vomiting or retching stimulated by looking at food. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry yang 羊 quoting Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 : 反胃，見食即嘔噦 , “Turned over stomach. When [the patient] sees food he immediately vomits”, writes: 反胃嘔食 , “Turned over stomach. [The patient] vomits when [he sees] food ”. The Shi yi de xiao fang 世醫得效方 uses ou shi 嘔食 in the sense of ou tu 嘔吐 , to vomit. However, as the Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 took its quote from the Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 , it may well have continued the meaning documented in that source text.
